member.name: P:OpenAI.Assistants.Assistant.Object
member.summary: The object type, which is always `assistant`.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Assistants.Assistant.NucleusSamplingFactor
member.summary:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.
We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

member.name: T:OpenAI.Assistants.AssistantCreationOptions
member.summary: Represents additional options available when creating a new .

member.name: P:OpenAI.Assistants.AssistantCreationOptions.Tools
member.summary:
A list of tool enabled on the assistant.
There can be a maximum of 128 tools per assistant. Tools can be of types `code_interpreter`, `file_search`, or `function`.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Assistants.AssistantCreationOptions.NucleusSamplingFactor
member.summary:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.
We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

member.name: M:OpenAI.Assistants.AssistantCreationOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of .

member.summary: The object type, which is always `assistant.deleted`.

member.summary: Represents additional options available when modifying an existing .

member.name: P:OpenAI.Assistants.AssistantModificationOptions.Model
member.summary: The replacement model that the assistant should use.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Assistants.AssistantModificationOptions.DefaultTools
member.summary:
A list of tool enabled on the assistant.
There can be a maximum of 128 tools per assistant. Tools can be of types `code_interpreter`, `file_search`, or `function`.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Assistants.AssistantModificationOptions.NucleusSamplingFactor
member.summary:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.
We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Assistants.AssistantThread.ToolResources
member.summary: The set of resources that are made available to the assistant's tools on this thread. The resources are specific to the type of tool. For example, the `code_interpreter` tool requires a list of file IDs, while the `file_search` tool requires a list of vector store IDs.

member.summary: Run-specific additional instructions that will be appended to the assistant-level instructions solely for this run. Unlike , the assistant's instructions are preserved and these additional instructions are concatenated.

member.summary: Adds additional messages to the thread before creating the run.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Assistants.RunCreationOptions.AllowParallelToolCalls
member.summary: Whether to enable parallel function calling during tool use.
member.remarks: Assumed true if not otherwise specified.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Assistants.RunCreationOptions.ToolsOverride
member.summary:
A run-specific collection of tool definitions that will override the assistant-level defaults. If not provided, the assistant's defined tools will be used. Available tools include:
code_interpreter - - works with data, math, and computer code
file_search - - dynamically enriches an Run's context with content from vector stores
function - - enables caller-provided custom functions for actions and enrichment

member.name: P:OpenAI.Assistants.RunCreationOptions.Metadata
member.summary: Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maxium of 512 characters long.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Assistants.RunCreationOptions.Temperature
member.summary: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Assistants.RunCreationOptions.NucleusSamplingFactor
member.summary:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.
We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Assistants.RunCreationOptions.MaxInputTokenCount
member.summary: The maximum number of prompt tokens that may be used over the course of the run. The run will make a best effort to use only the number of prompt tokens specified, across multiple turns of the run. If the run exceeds the number of prompt tokens specified, the run will end with status `incomplete`. See `incomplete_details` for more info.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Assistants.RunCreationOptions.MaxOutputTokenCount
member.summary: The maximum number of completion tokens that may be used over the course of the run. The run will make a best effort to use only the number of completion tokens specified, across multiple turns of the run. If the run exceeds the number of completion tokens specified, the run will end with status `incomplete`. See `incomplete_details` for more info.

member.summary: Controls for how a thread will be truncated prior to the run. Use this to control the intial context window of the run.

member.name: F:OpenAI.Assistants.RunTruncationStrategy.SerializedAdditionalRawData
member.summary:
Keeps track of any properties unknown to the library.
To assign an object to the value of this property use .
To assign an already formatted json string to this property use .
Examples:
BinaryData.FromObjectAsJson("foo") Creates a payload of "foo".
BinaryData.FromString("\"foo\"") Creates a payload of "foo".
BinaryData.FromObjectAsJson(new { key = "value" }) Creates a payload of { "key": "value" }.
BinaryData.FromString("{\"key\": \"value\"}") Creates a payload of { "key": "value" }.

member.name: F:OpenAI.Assistants.RunTruncationStrategy._type
member.summary: The truncation strategy to use for the thread. The default is `auto`. If set to `last_messages`, the thread will be truncated to the n most recent messages in the thread. When set to `auto`, messages in the middle of the thread will be dropped to fit the context length of the model, `max_prompt_tokens`.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Assistants.RunTruncationStrategy.LastMessages
member.summary: The number of most recent messages from the thread when constructing the context for the run.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Assistants.RunTruncationStrategy.Auto
member.summary: The default that will eliminate messages in the middle of the thread to fit within the context length of the model or the max prompt tokens.

member.name: M:OpenAI.Assistants.RunTruncationStrategy.CreateLastMessagesStrategy(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance using the last_messages strategy type, which will truncate the thread to specified count of preceding messages for the run.
member.param: The count of last messages that the run should evaluate.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Assistants.ThreadRun.NucleusSamplingFactor
member.summary:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.
We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.ChatCompletionOptions.Messages
member.summary: A list of messages comprising the conversation so far. [Example Python code](https://cookbook.openai.com/examples/how_to_format_inputs_to_chatgpt_models). Please note is the base class. According to the scenario, a derived class of the base class might need to be assigned here, or this property needs to be casted to one of the possible derived classes. The available derived classes include , , , and .

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.ChatCompletionOptions.Model
member.summary: ID of the model to use. See the model endpoint compatibility table for details on which models work with the Chat API.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.ChatCompletionOptions.N
member.summary: How many chat completion choices to generate for each input message. Note that you will be charged based on the number of generated tokens across all of the choices. Keep `n` as `1` to minimize costs.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.ChatCompletionOptions.Stream
member.summary: If set, partial message deltas will be sent, like in ChatGPT. Tokens will be sent as data-only [server-sent events](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Server-sent_events/Using_server-sent_events#Event_stream_format) as they become available, with the stream terminated by a `data: [DONE]` message. [Example Python code](https://cookbook.openai.com/examples/how_to_stream_completions).

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.ChatCompletionOptions.StreamOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the stream options.

member.name: M:OpenAI.Chat.ChatCompletionOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of for deserialization.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.ChatCompletionOptions.IncludeLogProbabilities
member.summary: Whether to return log probabilities of the output tokens or not. If true, returns the log probabilities of each output token returned in the message content.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.ChatCompletionOptions.TopLogProbabilityCount
member.summary: An integer between 0 and 20 specifying the number of most likely tokens to return at each token position, each with an associated log probability. must be set to if this property is used.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.ChatCompletionOptions.StopSequences
member.summary: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.ChatCompletionOptions.LogitBiases
member.summary: Modifies the likelihood of specified tokens appearing in the completion. It maps tokens (specified by their token ID in the tokenizer) to an associated bias value from -100 to 100. Mathematically, the bias is added to the logits generated by the model prior to sampling. The exact effect will vary per model, but values between -1 and 1 should decrease or increase likelihood of selection; values like -100 or 100 should result in a ban or exclusive selection of the relevant token.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.ChatCompletionOptions.ToolChoice
member.summary:
Specifies which tool is called by the model, if any. means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message. means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools. means the model must call one or more tools. The model can also be forced to call a specific tool by constructing a new instance of while passing the desired as a constructor parameter.
is the default behavior when no tools are present, while is the default if tools are present.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.ChatCompletionOptions.AllowParallelToolCalls
member.summary: Whether to enable parallel function calling during tool use.
member.remarks: Assumed true if not otherwise specified.

member.name: F:OpenAI.Chat.ChatCompletionOptions._serviceTier
member.summary: An object specifying the format that the model must output.

remarks.p: Compatible with GPT-4o, GPT-4o mini, GPT-4 Turbo and all GPT-3.5 Turbo models newer than gpt-3.5-turbo-1106.
Learn more in the Structured Outputs guide.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.ChatCompletionOptions.EndUserId
member.summary: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help OpenAI to monitor and detect abuse. Learn more.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.ChatCompletionOptions.Seed
member.summary: If specified, our system will make a best effort to sample deterministically, such that repeated requests with the same seed and parameters should return the same result.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.ChatCompletionOptions.MaxOutputTokenCount
member.summary: An upper bound for the number of tokens that can be generated for a completion, including visible output tokens and, on applicable models, reasoning tokens.

member.name: T:OpenAI.Chat.ChatFinishReason
member.summary:
The reason the model stopped generating tokens. This will be:
Property REST Condition
stop The model encountered a natural stop point or provided stop sequence.
length The maximum number of tokens specified in the request was reached.
content_filter Content was omitted due to a triggered content filter rule.
tool_calls
With no explicit tool_choice, the model called one or more tools that were defined in the request.
function_call (Deprecated) The model called a function that was defined in the request.

member.name: F:OpenAI.Chat.ChatFinishReason.Stop
member.summary: Indicates that the model encountered a natural stop point or provided stop sequence.

member.name: F:OpenAI.Chat.ChatFinishReason.Length
member.summary: Indicates that the model reached the maximum number of tokens allowed for the request.

member.name: F:OpenAI.Chat.ChatFinishReason.ContentFilter
member.summary: Indicates that content was omitted due to a triggered content filter rule.

member.name: F:OpenAI.Chat.ChatFinishReason.ToolCalls
member.summary: Indicates that the model called a function that was defined in the request.
member.remarks:
To resolve tool calls, append the message associated with the tool calls followed by matching instances of for each tool call, then perform another chat completion with the combined set of messages.
Note: is not provided as the finish_reason if the model calls a tool in response to an explicit tool_choice via . In that case, calling the specified tool is assumed and the expected reason is .

member.name: F:OpenAI.Chat.ChatFinishReason.FunctionCall
member.summary: Indicates that the model called a function that was defined in the request.
member.remarks: To resolve a function call, append the message associated with the function call followed by a with the appropriate name and arguments, then perform another chat completion with the combined set of messages.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.InternalCreateChatCompletionStreamResponseChoice.FinishReason
member.summary: The reason the model stopped generating tokens. This will be `stop` if the model hit a natural stop point or a provided stop sequence, `length` if the maximum number of tokens specified in the request was reached, `content_filter` if content was omitted due to a flag from our content filters, `tool_calls` if the model called a tool, or `function_call` (deprecated) if the model called a function.

member.summary: The token usage statistics for the entire chat completion.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.StreamingChatCompletionUpdate.FinishReason
member.summary:
The reason the model stopped generating tokens. This will be:
if the model hit a natural stop point or a provided stop sequence
if the maximum number of tokens specified in the request was reached
if content was omitted due to a flag from our content filters
if the model called a tool
(obsolte) if the model called a function

member.summary: The message content tokens with log probability information.

member.summary: The message refusal tokens with log probability information.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.StreamingChatCompletionUpdate.Role
member.summary: The role of the author of this message.
member.remarks: Typically present in a single streaming update but applicable to the entire chat completion.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.StreamingChatCompletionUpdate.ContentUpdate
member.summary: The contents of the message update.
member.remarks: Each streaming update contains only a small portion of tokens. To reconstitute the entire chat completion, all values across streaming updates must be combined.

member.summary: The tool calls generated by the model, such as function calls.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.StreamingChatFunctionCallUpdate.FunctionName
member.summary: The name of the function to call.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.StreamingChatFunctionCallUpdate.FunctionArgumentsUpdate
member.summary: Gets a function arguments fragment associated with this update.

remarks.para: Each update contains only a small number of tokens. When presenting or reconstituting a full, streamed arguments body, all values should be combined.

As is the case for non-streaming , the content provided for function arguments is not guaranteed to be well-formed JSON or to contain expected data. Callers should validate function arguments before using them.

member.name: T:OpenAI.Chat.StreamingChatToolCallUpdate
member.summary: A streaming update representing part of a tool call made by the model.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.StreamingChatToolCallUpdate.Kind
member.summary: The kind of tool.Currently, only is supported.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.StreamingChatToolCallUpdate.ToolCallId
member.summary: The unique identifier of the tool call being streamed, as used with e.g. or .

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.StreamingChatToolCallUpdate.FunctionName
member.summary: The name of the the tool that the streaming tool call requests invocation of.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Chat.StreamingChatToolCallUpdate.FunctionArgumentsUpdate
member.summary: The update to the arguments that the model is calling the function with, which are generated by the model in JSON format. As part of a streaming response, the arguments are chunked and streamed across streaming updates, and must therefore be accumulated in order to reconstruct them. Note that the model does not always generate valid JSON, and may hallucinate parameters not defined by your function schema. Validate the arguments in your code before calling your function.

member.name: T:OpenAI.Chat.SystemChatMessage
member.summary: Represents a chat message of the system role as supplied to a chat completion request. A system message is generally supplied as the first message to a chat completion request and guides the model's behavior across future assistant role response messages. These messages may help control behavior, style, tone, and restrictions for a model-based assistant.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Embeddings.EmbeddingGenerationOptions.Input
member.summary:
Input text to embed, encoded as a string or array of tokens. To embed multiple inputs in a single request, pass an array of strings or array of token arrays. Each input must not exceed the max input tokens for the model (8191 tokens for `text-embedding-ada-002`) and cannot be an empty string. [Example Python code](https://github.com/openai/openai-cookbook/blob/main/examples/How_to_count_tokens_with_tiktoken.ipynb) for counting tokens.
To assign an object to this property use .
To assign an already formatted json string to this property use .
Supported types:
where T is of type
where T is of type
where T is of type IList{long}
Examples:
BinaryData.FromObjectAsJson("foo") Creates a payload of "foo".
BinaryData.FromString("\"foo\"") Creates a payload of "foo".
BinaryData.FromObjectAsJson(new { key = "value" }) Creates a payload of { "key": "value" }.
BinaryData.FromString("{\"key\": \"value\"}") Creates a payload of { "key": "value" }.

[Protocol Method] Upload a file that can be used across various endpoints. The size of all the files uploaded by one organization can be up to 100 GB.
The size of individual files can be a maximum of 512 MB or 2 million tokens for Assistants. See the Assistants Tools guide to learn more about the types of files supported. The Fine-tuning API only supports `.jsonl` files.
Please contact us if you need to increase these storage limits.

member.name: F:OpenAI.Images.GeneratedImageSize.W256xH256
member.summary:
A small, square image with 256 pixels of both width and height.

member.name: F:OpenAI.Images.GeneratedImageSize.W512xH512

A medium-small, square image with 512 pixels of both width and height.
Supported only for the older dall-e-2 model.

member.name: F:OpenAI.Images.GeneratedImageSize.W1024xH1024
member.summary:
A square image with 1024 pixels of both width and height.
Supported and default for both dall-e-2 and dall-e-3 models.

member.name: F:OpenAI.Images.GeneratedImageSize.W1024xH1792
member.summary:
An extra tall image, 1024 pixels wide by 1792 pixels high.
Supported only for the dall-e-3 model.

member.name: F:OpenAI.Images.GeneratedImageSize.W1792xH1024
member.summary:
An extra wide image, 1792 pixels wide by 1024 pixels high.
Supported only for the dall-e-3 model.

member.name: T:OpenAI.Images.ImageEditOptions
member.summary: Represents additional options available to control the behavior of an image generation operation.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Images.ImageEditOptions.Model
member.summary: The model to use for image generation. Only `dall-e-2` is supported at this time.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Images.ImageEditOptions.Image
member.summary:
The image to edit. Must be a valid PNG file, less than 4MB, and square. If mask is not provided, image must have transparency, which will be used as the mask.
To assign a byte[] to this property use . The byte[] will be serialized to a Base64 encoded string.
Examples:
BinaryData.FromBytes(new byte[] { 1, 2, 3 }) Creates a payload of "AQID".

member.name: P:OpenAI.Images.ImageEditOptions.Prompt
member.summary: A text description of the desired image(s). The maximum length is 1000 characters.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Images.ImageEditOptions.Mask
member.summary:
An additional image whose fully transparent areas (e.g. where alpha is zero) indicate where `image` should be edited. Must be a valid PNG file, less than 4MB, and have the same dimensions as `image`.
To assign a byte[] to this property use . The byte[] will be serialized to a Base64 encoded string.
Examples:
BinaryData.FromBytes(new byte[] { 1, 2, 3 }) Creates a payload of "AQID".

member.name: P:OpenAI.Images.ImageEditOptions.N
member.summary: The number of images to generate. Must be between 1 and 10.

member.name: M:OpenAI.Images.ImageEditOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .

member.name: P:OpenAI.Images.ImageEditOptions.Size
member.summary: The size of the generated images. Must be one of `256x256`, `512x512`, or `1024x1024`.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Images.ImageEditOptions.ResponseFormat
member.summary: The format in which the generated images are returned. Must be one of `url` or `b64_json`.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Images.ImageEditOptions.EndUserId
member.summary: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help OpenAI to monitor and detect abuse. Learn more.

member.name: T:OpenAI.Images.ImageGenerationOptions
member.summary: Represents additional options available to control the behavior of an image generation operation.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Images.ImageGenerationOptions.Model
member.summary: The model to use for image generation.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Images.ImageGenerationOptions.Prompt
member.summary: A text description of the desired image(s). The maximum length is 1000 characters for `dall-e-2` and 4000 characters for `dall-e-3`.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Images.ImageGenerationOptions.N
member.summary: The number of images to generate. Must be between 1 and 10. For `dall-e-3`, only `n=1` is supported.

member.name: M:OpenAI.Images.ImageGenerationOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .

member.name: P:OpenAI.Images.ImageGenerationOptions.EndUserId
member.summary: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help OpenAI to monitor and detect abuse. Learn more.

member.name: T:OpenAI.Images.ImageVariationOptions
member.summary: Represents additional options available to control the behavior of an image generation operation.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Images.ImageVariationOptions.Model
member.summary: The model to use for image generation. Only `dall-e-2` is supported at this time.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Images.ImageVariationOptions.Image
member.summary:
The image to use as the basis for the variation(s). Must be a valid PNG file, less than 4MB, and square.
To assign a byte[] to this property use . The byte[] will be serialized to a Base64 encoded string.
Examples:
BinaryData.FromBytes(new byte[] { 1, 2, 3 }) Creates a payload of "AQID".

member.name: P:OpenAI.Images.ImageVariationOptions.N
member.summary: The number of images to generate. Must be between 1 and 10.

member.name: M:OpenAI.Images.ImageVariationOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .

member.name: P:OpenAI.Images.ImageVariationOptions.Size
member.summary: The size of the generated images. Must be one of `256x256`, `512x512`, or `1024x1024`.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Images.ImageVariationOptions.ResponseFormat
member.summary: The format in which the generated images are returned. Must be one of `url` or `b64_json`.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Images.ImageVariationOptions.EndUserId
member.summary: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help OpenAI to monitor and detect abuse. Learn more.

member.name: P:OpenAI.Moderations.ModerationOptions.Model
member.summary: Two content moderations models are available: `text-moderation-stable` and `text-moderation-latest`. The default is `text-moderation-latest` which will be automatically upgraded over time. This ensures you are always using our most accurate model. If you use `text-moderation-stable`, we will provide advanced notice before updating the model. Accuracy of `text-moderation-stable` may be slightly lower than for `text-moderation-latest`.

member.name: P:OpenAI.OpenAIClientOptions.Endpoint
member.summary: The service endpoint that the client will send requests to. If not set, the default endpoint will be used.

member.name: P:OpenAI.OpenAIClientOptions.OrganizationId
member.summary: The value to use for the OpenAI-Organization request header. Users who belong to multiple organizations can set this value to specify which organization is used for an API request. Usage from these API requests will count against the specified organization's quota. If not set, the header will be omitted, and the default organization will be billed. You can change your default organization in your user settings. Learn more.

member.name: P:OpenAI.OpenAIClientOptions.ProjectId
member.summary: The value to use for the OpenAI-Project request header. Users who are accessing their projects through their legacy user API key can set this value to specify which project is used for an API request. Usage from these API requests will count as usage for the specified project. If not set, the header will be omitted, and the default project will be accessed.

member.name: P:OpenAI.OpenAIClientOptions.UserAgentApplicationId
